The expert: s investigation highlights that studies conducted by the Joint Committee on Taxation and the Urban Institute-Brookings Institution Tax Policy Center suggest that many wealthy Americans will receive tax cuts, while some may end up paying more. The analysis does not confirm that only residents of San Francisco and Manhattan will face higher taxes, but it does indicate that wealthier workers in high-tax states and cities are at risk of paying more due to the limitation on deducting state and local income taxes.
